report_text: Examination: CHEST (PORTABLE AP) Indication: History of fever and cough. Findings: There is a patchy opacity in the right lower lobe consistent with pneumonia. The heart size is normal. No pleural effusion or pneumothorax is seen. Impression: Right lower lobe pneumonia.

Examination: CHEST (LATERAL) Indication: Follow-up. Findings: Persistent opacity in the right lower lobe. Small trace of pleural fluid. Cardiac silhouette remains stable. Impression: Pneumonia with trace effusion.

Examination: CHEST (PA AND LATERAL) Indication: Pre-op evaluation. Findings: The lungs are clear. The cardiomediastinal silhouette is within normal limits. No acute osseous abnormalities. Impression: No acute cardiopulmonary abnormality.
